comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Used in book: The nations at war, August 1914 - August 1916 By Willis John Abbot books.google.com/books?id=KOk7AQAAIAAJ&pg=PA163&l...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ferdinand_von_Zeppelin Honolulu Evening bulletin., March 21, 1910, 2:30 EDITION, Page 6, Image 6 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn82016413/1910-03-21/ed-... links Zeppelin and Heigesell in relation to an expedition to the North Pole using a Zeppelin airship. The general suitability of balloons for polar exploration has survived for a century. See ScienceDaily: Zeppelin Expedition Will Survey Sea Ice In The Arctic www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2007/04/070412093800.htm

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The Professor's last name appears actually to be Hergesell. See, e.g., www.photolib.noaa.gov/htmls/ship4536.htm First name appears to be Hugo metafrog.blogspot.com/2007/04/hugo-hergesell-scientist-te... Here's another LoC picture of Hergesell: www.loc.gov/pictures/item/2002722092/

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: swanq:  Thanks for the link to the book where this picture appeared, and for the correct spelling for Professor Hergesell's name.  We'll include this information next time we update the description.
